abstract: The deal to pay $3.6 billion for wireless airwaves owned by Time Warner Cable, Comcast, Cox Communications and Bright House Networks still needs F.C.C. approval.
snippet: The deal to pay $3.6 billion for wireless airwaves owned by Time Warner Cable, Comcast, Cox Communications and Bright House Networks still needs F.C.C. approval.
lead_paragraph: The United States Justice Department approved a deal struck by Verizon Wireless to purchase spectrum from the country’s largest cable operators, but officials also required that the agreement be altered to protect against higher prices for consumers.

headline.main: Justice Dept. Approves, With Changes, Verizon Wireless Spectrum Purchase
